intro: Oenothera turoviensis, commonly known as the Turovinskaya evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by moths, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Oenothera turoviensis is a perennial herb that is often found in steppe and forest-steppe habitats.
